text:
Saya menginap 1 malam bersama 2 anak saya usia 8 & 12 tahun. Kebetulan si kecil Tian sedang berulangtahun dan saat masuk kamar sudah tersedia slice cake ultah sesuai permintaan saya dan juga art towel diatas tempat tidur ❤.
Yang mengejutkan, saat sarapan pagi staff restoran memberi kejutan waffle yg sudah dihias sebagai kejutan ulangtahun buat anak saya, menawarkan es krim dan juga memberi donat untuk bekal si kecil makan di jalan.(duuh...tau aja kalau anak saya suka! 😍) Saya merasa disambut sekali dengan keramahan staff terutama mbak Diana dan pak Gerryd. Trimakasih ya...🙏
Kolam renangnya cakeep...apalagi saat sunrise dan sunset. Viewnya sangat bagus, Marina Baysands-Singapore pun terlihat jelas saat cuaca cerah.
Trimakasih untuk keramahan dan layanannya Batam Marriott 👍. Smoga suatu saat saya bisa kesni lagi 🥰

text: dari pertama telpon dikasih nomor sales marketing mas ilham dan mba nana yg baik dan ramah dan sangat membantu, pas checkin kunci telah tersedia dibantu checkin dengan ramah pula oleh mba yosie, setelah selesai, saya masuk kamar... wwooowww luarbiasa NYAMAN Banget...Bersih,rapi,wangi...pas buka gorden,eh otomatis pula,maka tersajilah pemandangan laut dan pulau Batam nan indah dengan gemerlap cahaya lampunya. karena lelah diperjalanan saya langsung mandi dan segera minikmati tempat tidur yg sangat empuk....keesokan paginya setelah subuhan, waktunya sarapan pagi...pelayanan yg ramah senawarkan sajian yg istimewa dan enaaakkk...dan saya diperkenalkan dengan chef Mas Muhammad. setelah sarapan saya berjalan" melihat suasana hotel, saya didekati dengan senyum ramah menyapa saya, Mas Randi namanya, kemudian mas Randi mengajak saya melihat lihat keindahan Hotel Marriott Batam. setelah berjalan jalan ternyata hp saya lowbat, karena ketinggalan charger, maka saya dibantu oleh mas pito direception hotel. Barang berharga yang lupa disimpan, tetap aman dan dipajang ditempat sama dengan cakep 🥰

text:
Whilst on our honeymoon we spent two nights at the Marriott Hotel to celebrate my husband's birthday. Our stay at the hotel was extraordinary due to the attentive and most welcoming service we have been given by the staff. Apart from that, the selection of food that was presented during breakfast was surprisingly the best one we have ever been to. The food in each restaurant of the hotel was always super delicious and couldn't get enough of it. The room that we stayed in was spacious, full of light with the best ocean view ever.
 I would like to personally thank the staff especially Rahmat Laewang who made sure that we have the most unforgivable experience ever at the hotel ❤️ He provided information on our stay before actually arriving at the hotel which was very helpful. He decorated our room twice during our stay and even left us handwritten notes to congratulate us on our honeymoon and for my husband's birthday. Apart from that he organised my husband's celebration dinner with the sweetest gesture ever. The staff and service at the Marriott have touched our hearts and we will be back for sure!
title: Impeccable service and staff!

text:
Had a wondeful stay at Marriott Batam!
Kudos to the entire staff! Thank you Mr Rahmat (front desk staff), for ensuring we enjoyed our stay! It was a delightful experience indeed! Will definitey book again!

text: Had a wonderful evening with my partner at Altitude bar. Excellent and truly gracious service by Mr Rizal and fantastic drinks made by the bartender, Mr Yusuf! Would highly recommend anyone visiting Batam to come here, and look for these guys for a great evening :)
title: Fantastic evening at Altitude Bar!

text:
This is our 1st visit to the island. Upon check in, showing my partner’s Lifetime Titanium status, we were ushered to the club lounge for a more private setting. The staff on duty that day were Ms Enggar and Mr Pito. Both were highly professional and efficient  during the check in process and later Mr Pito escorted us to our suite. 

Overall, we were so pleased with all the club lounge staff, we would like to show our appreciation to Ms Enggar for always conducting herself in the most professional manner. Mr Pito is highly efficient and always with positive vibes when engaging with the guests. Ms Jennifer (trainee) is always enthusiastic to learn. Ms Rena is one staff that is very approachable and with such cheerful disposition. She went that extra miles to help us. Ms Sazwa has this ‘ready to serve’ attitude at all time. 

The F&B in both the Goji restaurant (which we enjoyed during breakfast) and the evening snacks (offered in the lounge) were simply divine, there is a vast selections and it changes daily and one can never get tired of the offerings. This is truly a solid top notch 5 star ⭐️ hotel and the staff provided genuine services from the heart.

Last but not least, we were delighted to have gotten acquainted with Mr Saddam, the guest loyalty manager. After numerous chat sessions, we can be so bold to declare that he is indeed a great asset and was very meticulous in his work and tries his utmost best to uplift and maintain the high standard of this hotel which it is striving for. This is one rare hotel that has a valuable philosophy that can be an exemplary to other Marriott properties and that is choosing to prioritise to pamper and value their elite members over revenues. 

In conclusion, this brief exploratory trip has superseded our expectation and we will definitely be back and for sure for a longer stay. Thanks a zillion again for the heartwarming services which we felt it through and through during this short stay. 

Tip: the hotel provides services to the hotel guest over car with a chauffeur. However, the price requested is exorbitantly high, you can rent a taxi outside for a significantly lower amount upon mutual negotiable price.
title: Found a ‘GEM’ in this island

text: Magnificent view along with excellent service. Special thanks to Duty Manager Sam and Guest Services Agent Mr. Rahmat Yusri for their kind service and assisting me from pre-arrival to check in to ensure my needs are taken care of. Will definitely return to Batam more often to stay with Marriott!

text: Rahmat has been the star of our stay and the highlight of our trip! We were impressed not only by the hardware of this hotel but also the heart ware. Other than being conveniently located next to the ferry terminal with the amenities fitting a Marriott, our stay was made extra special by each staff we encountered at the hotel. Rahmat at front desk made an extra effort to have the room decorated for our birthday celebration, Aldi made sure the hotel shuttle took us to the nearby restaurant for dinner, Febryan made sure he picked us up and had us back at the hotel after our dinner. Imelda took care of us during breakfast. We wanted to have a drink at Altitude after dinner but we’re disappointed to know it’s closed for a private event. Knowing we were there to celebrate a birthday, Rocky made an exception for us to have a quick look at the beautiful rooftop bar before it opens the next day before we took our ferry back to Singapore, and Srfaq showed us around the bar. Marriott Hotel made our stay comfortable and each staff we met during our short trip made our stay an incredibly special one. Marriott has got all the right people and showed us what hospitality is with everybody doing their best above and beyond what anyone would expect. We love this property and its wonderful people, and will be back again to visit!
title: Amazing Birthday Celebration at Batam Marriott

text:
What you expect from a 5 stars hotel you will find it here. This hotel is still new (as at Dec-2022) and is very clean. 

If you get a sea view room, depending on the weather and you may able to see sunset from your from. The swimming pool is disappointing as it small in size. Gym room is just next to the swimming pool. 

If you travel from Singapore Harbour Front ferry terminal, you may want to consider to take Horizon Ferry service as the hotel lobby is connected to Hourbor Bay ferry terminal. That’s a small shopping mall next to the hotel and you can do some simple shoppings if you lazy to go Batam town for shopping. Breakfast at the hotel lobby is so so. There are many restaurants around the hotel areas, so you will be spoiled by dinner options. 

Overall, is a good hotel and a good option to consider if you want to relax and run away from noisy city life.
title: Batam Marriott Harbour Bay Hotel

text:
This is our 2nd visit to Marriott Batam Harbour Bay in Dec 22! The hotel has great views and is a very new hotel. When we first visited for my birthday earlier this month,  I was very impressed with the hospitality of the staff we interacted with, and they even had a surprise birthday cake prepared for me when we were having breakfast. 

When we came here the 2nd time, some of the staff remembered us and welcomed us with such warmth! The staff members, in particular Nazirah, Saddam and Enggar, was always making sure that we were taken care of, and we even had conversations with them and it was almost like our 2nd home. Covid has made travel and hospitality industry very tough, but seeing how passionate they are in their job and always doing their utmost to ensure guests have a great experience touches my heart. Looking forward to coming back soon!

Love this hotel! Clean, comfortable and close to the Ferry Terminal.

The rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious and we throughly enjoyed the breakfast buffet. 

We had dinner at Jiang He Restaurant to celebrate a friend's birthday and were served by Titin who gave us the best care and attention. We throughly enjoyed our dinner and we even received a birthday cake at the end! The whole experience made his birthday celebratiom a memorable one and we would like to say thanks to the F&B staff Aan, Fiky, Dio and Cindy and Aris and Friska. 

Overall we had the most perfect weekend. The standard of cleanliness and comfort at this hotel was outstanding and our room had everything we needed. Can't wait to come back!
title: The Perfect Weekend

text:
I’ve just checked out of the hotel and writing this review for anyone looking at a convenient and relaxed holiday - do consider Marriott at Harbourbay! Absolutely delightful stay and much-needed break for us. The hotel staff went the extra mile in their hospitality, greeting services and everything else. 
We booked via the Marriott website and before our arrival, every time we had some queries the hotel staff was very pleasant, prompt and welcoming to help. 
Reaching the hotel from Singapore HarbourFront terminal is such a breeze! Horizon ferry brings you right upto the hotel front! So convenient! 
Our check-in was super smooth, and very fast. Though our room wasn’t ready at arrival (we came in much before the check in time of 3pm - can check prior if they can accommodate early check-in), we went exploring the nearby area - lots of eateries and hanging out options within walking distance of 1km or less. We were allocated a room on the tenth floor and what a view! The bed was comfortable, and the bathtub was extremely relaxing for me. The breakfast service is extensive, lots of Asian options and their signature omelette is a must-have. Even the bakery items and the local delights are very good. Special mention the nasi goreng - It was my repeat order over 2.5 days of stay! Loved it! Ask for the seafood catch of the day - we had Norwegian salmon, and it was just perfectly made and flavoured. No fuss about it. I also really enjoyed the gym - super view and though we didn’t use the pool this time, we will return for it. It’s on the same level as the gym and oversees the water - wow again! Also check out altitude bar at the rooftop for stunning views! Special mention to the housekeeping staff for prepping our room with such a thoughtful gesture as we were celebrating our anniversary weekend! Thank you so much! We really appreciate the lengths you take to make our stay comfortable and memorable and upkeep of our room! 🙏
title: Top notch stay and enjoyable hospitality!!

text:
Thank you to the associates at Batam Marriott Hotel Harbour Bay for such a great stay! Every single associate we had the pleasure of interacting with were so genuine, and were always seen smiling. 

This modern hotel is conveniently located above the Harbour Bay Ferry Terminal, and getting there was such a breeze. 

Modern interior, high ceilings, exuding a luxurious vibe. Service was polite and unintrusive. Reza at the Front Desk was really hospitable. 

Highly recommend travelers to upgrade to the executive lounge access as it boasts a panoramic view of Batam. Thank you to Mr. Pito in the executive lounge for telling us more about Batam and the local area.  

They had a great selection of breakfast buffet items at Goji Restaurant. Very fresh seafood items on the menu - the prawns at The Lounge & Jiang He restaurant was chefs kiss. 👌🏻

I also had a great back massage at Quan Spa. Special thanks to Ms Seri Makta for a rejuvenating experience. 

Batam Marriott Hotel Harbour Bay also has a rooftop bar - Altitude which offers nice views of the city. Ambience was nice. 

Overall, I didn’t feel the need to step out of the hotel as the hotel had everything. We went for a stroll to the restaurants along the bay which was less than 5 minutes away. 

I will definitely return. Looking forward to my next trip! Thanks everyone!

title: Good vibe

text:
My partner booked a standard room for my birthday. 

The room was on the 12th floor with harbour view (room 1231). The hotel building is 13 floors with the lounge on the top floor. The room came with king sized bed with bay window seats, the bathroom had a bath tub and a separate shower room. 

Plus point for ladies, powerful hairdryer! 

Love that there was a day curtain (manual) and blackout curtain (automatic with switch) to adjust natural light coming into the room. 

The staff throughout the hotel was polite and helpful. 

The pool + swirl pool + kids pool is on the 5th floor overlooking the sea. The gym (24 hours) and spa (was advised by the spa staff they opens 10am to 10pm daily) is also on the 5th floor, easily accessible from the lift lobby. 

The gym is well equipped with 3 treadmills, 2 elliptical, 3 stationary bikes, 2 free weight benches and some machines. 

The pool is clean (my stay was on weekdays) 25m in length at its longest length. Decent for laps. Great views overlooking the sea. The the whirlpool at the side is a plus point. 

Level 2 of the hotel connects to the adjacent Bayfront mall. The restaurants at the promenade are accessible from level 1 of the hotel lobby. There are a lot of food choices, mostly seafood restaurants. Also a hotpot restaurant. 

Only disappointment was the spa (Quan Spa). Went for the Quan Day Ritual for Two (2.5 hours) which included stone massage, ear candling, coffee body scrub and mask (plus V-spa Retus for ladies) for Rp 2,000,000 before taxes (with taxes was about Rp 4,000,000 = SGD 400). Quality of masseurs was poor (massage techniques, temp of the hot stones), inattentive service, unclear instructions (possible due to language; masseurs speaking simple English). Wasn’t told about the start of the mask, only to realized we had to rest for 15 mins for the masking process. Also insufficient information given for V-Spa Retus which was done near the end of spa session. Quite disappointing given the price point.
title: Clean, spacious room with modern design. Polite staff throughout the hotel.

text:
To the team at Batam Marriott,

We had an amazing stay at the Batam Marriott. Being seasoned travellers, it takes a lot to wow us but this hotel was simply outstanding.

First things first, the location. How splendid to get off the boat and walk to your hotel. No need for road transfers!

The room - beautiful layout. Two televisions, ample space, lots of space to lounge, amazing view, room was extremely clean, double toilets. Simple things like a bathmat is so appreciated for families with kids. It's means a safe bathtime for my children and that was something I appreciated so much.

The hotel dining. Where do I even begin? The food was good in all areas we ordered - restaurant to in room dining. Never a drop in quality. It's insane. Unbelievable actually. The Chinese restaurant served such amazing food that was so different from the usual - my jaw dropped when I took my first bite. I will be back again to eat. Such a humble chef that cooks such amazing food!

Service level from all were just of such high standards. Zero complains. Even when I had to call the operator, it was answered so well too.

A huge thank you to the following staff who went above and beyond to make up feel so cared for: Titin, Fauzi, Etha, Dedy and so many more that I just can't remember. 

Sounds too good to be true? This is what my 4yr old son said:

"Yes, the hotel was really nice. Now we are back to our old hotel. Our house. So sad right?

My beautiful home was downgraded after this trip.  

You outdid yourself, Batam Marriott. We are already planning our next trip.

From the Nathan's.
title: Back to Batam after 5yrs!

text:
The Marriot here is very new and I heard the only 5 starred hotel in Batam, Indonesia. Rooms are excellent and I recommend the Harbour/Sea view rooms which had spectacular views of the sunsets! I stayed in room 709 and the room was huge with a king sized bed and plenty of space to lounge around. The overhead rain shower in the bathroom was my favorite!

Next, the staff were mostly very friendly and very attentive to your needs. The porters and doormen were all very friendly and helpful! I'd like to thank a couple of them who made my stay and our extended family's stay (my mum, mum in-law,  uncle and aunt included) here an enjoyable and comfortable one. 

Daniel, the manager at the restaurant where we had our breakfast was always ready to greet us with a smile and always making sure we had what we needed. He was always very friendly and asked about our previous day and how it was. 
Irwansyah over in the Altitude rooftop bar (spectacilar view of the bay and sunsets by the way) was always ready with a smile! Great service!

My only gripe with the hotel was that the housekeeping staff were slow in cleaning the rooms and on one of the days, our room wasn't cleaned yet when we came back in the evening and even after telling the staff whom we saw at the hallway, they did not clean the room until I called up the reception and complained which was why I am giving the hotel 4/5 stars.
title: Great hotel, great staff! Worth a visit and stay!

text: This is my second visit to the Marriott. The first one was fabulous and this stay was just as fabulous. I went there with my 2 daughters and granddaughter to celebrate their birthday. Rahmat from front desk was just amazing as he organised the most extradonary  welcome surprise fr us. The room was decorated with balloons, and so many other things to not only welcome us back but to surprise my daughters fr their birthday. We we speechless and so touched. Rahmat always makes our stay exceptional and his service and wonderful gestures are beyond words. We love the marriott because its like a home away frm home. All the staff frm the concierge to front deck to dining, housekeeping are fabulous. I also want to mention Rizal who is working at dining and room service, when we were there the last time he was stationed at the pool and his personality and kind gestures was amazing. My granddaughter took to him and always spoke abt him. We were sad that he was not stationed at the pool but was so happy to see him when we were having breakfast. He remembered our names and my granddaughter was do happy to see him. The service he gave us was exceptional. I would like to thank everyone at the marriott who made our stay so wonderful. Best hotel that I have ever experienced. Thank you Rahmat for everything u have done going out of your way to give us exceptional service and for making my daughters birthday so memorable. I don't know the names of the other staff at reception and dining but they were all fabulous. It's people like this that makes a hotel a place to come back to. Service beyond words and expectation. Service that is truly genuine and comes from the heart of the staff. The rooms were clean and there were no complains at all about any of the staff or departments. Room service was fast and excellent. Housekeeping was also fast when we asked for extra pillows and toiletries. The only thing that I felt was not great was the spa. The staff there are friendly and the environment is lovely but the massage was below average. I hope that there will be better people doing the massage bcos for what we are paying it was really not good at all. This is my second time at the spa and I was hoping that it was going to be better and even my daughters felt that it was below average. That is my only complain. We went to the spa bcos it was raining and didn't want to travel to the mall fr massage. But the massage was very disappointing. Apart from that everything else is exceptional. We will definetely return to the marriott. A place which is our second home.

title: Excellent Hotel Service

text:
We had an amazing wedding anniversary at Marriott Harbour Bay Batam. The suite was new, spacious and comfortable - literally what you would expect of Marriott's standards.

But what was most impressive was it's software - it's human capital. We would ordinarily expect and had actually braced ourselves for the possibility that there will be some hiccups or service issues for a brand new hotel based on our past experience. This was fortunately not the case with Marriott Batam.

From check in to room service to the executive lounge and breakfast, the service level of each and every staff at Marriott Batam was just nothing short of impeccable. If I were to name all of them, it will take me a long time but I am going to try anyway.

To: Kiki, Ellina, Sharon, Saddam from the executive lounge, Adi and Valen from housekeeping, staff from the breakfast at Goji Bar, from the front desk who checked us in so efficiently, and the bell service staff who were always ready to greet us so politely each time we step in and out of the hotel entrance : 

Thank you for being so pleasant and service oriented, and for making our stay so comfortable and making us feel so pampered.

You are just so amazing and indisputable ambassadors of the Marriott brand.

And to the General Manager and management of Marriott Batam, we know that your tone at the top matterdd as much and is undoubtedly the reason for our exceptional experience here. 

We will certainly be back , with our family members, we promise.

Thanks so much for your kind efforts and awesome service.

Warmest Regards

Mr and Mrs Tay

text:
We were there for 3 nights to celebrate my husband’s 50th birthday. First of all the location is superb as the hotel is walking distance to the habour, restaurants, bars, mall, Eska spa. Perfect for us as we just want to rest and don’t have to run around taking taxi to everywhere.
When we arrived we were given the room facing the car park area , my husband was not really happy and we told Ms Indri if we can have a different room and Ms. Indi helped us immediately and changed our room to the ocean view room, infact she wanted to upgrade us to the room with the balcony but at the lower floor but finally we chose the room which is facing the harbour. I can’t thank enough to Ms Indri and Mr. Rahmat friendliness,  super helpful and very thoughtful.
To be honest I cannot remember all the names but the staff hospitality are top notch. I told the staff at the restaurant that my husband is going to celebrate his 50th Birthday the next day and during our breakfast, the staff Ms. Alda, Ms. Gina, Mr. Wansyah, Mr. Daniel, Ms Leli and a few more staff, sorry I missed all their names. They came with a piece of cake and sang happy birthday, what a lovely surprise and beautiful atmosphere. They also arranged a beautiful deco and a piece of cake in our room while we were having our breakfast downstairs. Thank you to the housekeeping team Alfon and Evie. Thanks Mr. Rahmat for made it happen as I changed the timing from 3pm to the breakfast time to arrange the deco in our room. 
Our last day, our ferry back to SG was at 4.30pm and I asked the staff at the reception counter if we can extend our room and to our surprise, she gave it to us until 3pm. Again I cannot remember her name, I am sorry. Overall we had a fantastic time at Marriot Batam. The hospitality from the frontdesk, the reception area, the security, the staff at the restaurant I can write more and more good things about them nonstop lol. Thanks for making our stay and my husband’s birthday memorable and unforgettable. Oh yes we had Elite afternoon tea there too and it was delicious, but you have to book earlier like one day early so the staff can prepare accordingly. Overall it was a perfect 3 nights getaway. Thanks again for making us feel like home. All the best Marriot Batam. Lots of love from us Mr and Mrs Scholz.
title: Thank you Marriot Batam

text: This is our second stay in a Marriott hotel and we thought the first one in Malaysia was outstanding, the one in Batam surpasses it.  From the moment you walk in you are made to feel like a welcomed guest and it doesn't end throughout the whole stay.   We arrived from Singapore on a ferry on Saturday 9th July and left on Tuesday 12th.   The public areas of the coffee shop, bar and dinning areas are stunning, beautiful timber crafted furniture and architectural  details that give modern tasteful Indonesian feel was everywhere.  The pool area on the 5th floor had views across the ocean inlet to Batam.   We mostly ate at the hotel and found the prices reasonable and the food delicious.   We did prefer the room service breakfast to the buffet - but this is personal preference.   Our room was luxurious and came with plenty of bottled water and toiletries.  We also used the spa, and my husband enjoyed his massage.   The surrounding areas to the hotel weren't the best, some restaurants along a board walk which were mostly open for dinner and a few shops in the ferry terminal.  Any thing else was a taxi ride away.   The only thing missing was a list of activities to do in Batam.     The big question - would we stay here again - YES!
title: Stunning

text:
I ought to start the review by disclosing that we went there over the Eid Al Adha long weekend, when they were supposed to be more busy and therefore maybe ought to cut them some slack.

That said, I am not sure if I was just plain unlucky, but the entire stay was just a series of disappointments and frustrations, and our stay in the Marriott turned out to be the worst part of our entire weekend in Batam.

When booking the rooms, and again a couple of days before check-in, I requested connecting rooms because I was travelling with 2 young children and a senior, and needed connecting rooms to be able to take care of them. My requests were acknowledged, with the written responses being they would try their best.

We arrived at about 1045 in the morning, and we were told there were no connecting rooms available. I said I could wait until dinner time for the rooms, when hopefully some of their guests have already checked out, availing of connecting rooms. The staff member said that could help, and she would try to get us the connecting rooms when we returned. 

However, when we got back to the hotel after 8pm and asked for our connecting rooms, we were told that there was no such request logged in the system. However, out of immense goodwill, generosity, and charity, we were given rooms on the same level to make it easy for me to care for my young children and senior parent. When we got to the rooms, we realised they were on separate ends of the corridor - great!

When settling down in the room, we also realised that cleanliness wasn't that great. The kids were asking why the pillows "were so stinky" - the first time they have ever made such a comment after staying in many hotels across 4 continents.

We next asked housekeeping for body lotion - a standard item in most hotel bathrooms, and then were told that the hotel had run out of those.

Sound-proofing wasn't great either. We were kept awake by loud music from outside the building until pretty late. We also knew a few of our neighbours had the habit of returning to their rooms past midnight on both nights that we were there, and even knew where exactly they were out partying.

Things didn't get better the following day. At breakfast, half the food offerings were out at any point of time, and the coffee machine was down most of the time, possibly from over-use. Orders were repeatedly forgotten, and nobody came to remove plates - the kids were making the most of that by playing the stacking game to see how high the plates could go.

We had to ask 4 different staff members for children's cutlery, only to be finally told that they did not have children's cutlery anywhere within this hotel. I don't think I have ever heard such a thing like that in any other hotel anywhere else in the world.

Next I booked a spa session for the wife and mother. Booked it for 4.30pm, but at 4.15pm just when they were leaving the room to make their way to the spa, we received a call  asking if we could postpone the session to 5pm instead. We informed the caller that we had a dinner reservation, and had to stick with the timing. She then said it was OK, they would stick with the originally-agreed timing.

In the end, the wife and mother were kept sitting around and waiting for 45 minutes before their therapists were finally ready to begin their sessions. The wife told them that we would miss our dinner appointment, and had to cancel the session. The staff members insisted if they were to cancel the session, we would still have to pay the full price as a cancellation penalty, even though it was the staff's fault for being 45 minutes late!

So we ended up with a spa session that began and ended 45 minutes late, a missed dinner reservation, a couple of kids who were hungry and cranky and had to be distracted with snacks while waiting 45 minutes for their mum and granny, resulting in more frustrations for everyone at dinner because they no longer had an appetite for a proper meal and were just too drowsy because it was too close to bedtime.

Elite members were offered cocktail vouchers at the rooftop bar, which I thought was a nice touch. While the disastrous spa session was taking place, I thought to bring the kids to the bar to utilise the vouchers. Unfortunately we were turned away because children were not allowed at the rooftop bar. I was then advised to bring the kids and vouchers to the lobby lounge instead, where I was assured they would also honour the vouchers.

When I got to the lobby lounge, I was told the vouchers were only valid at the rooftop bar and nowhere else. I told them I was turned away and referred to the lobby lounge, the gentleman at the lobby lounge insisted he would not accept the vouchers. He then told me I could leave my 7yo and 4yo alone in the room, and go by myself to the rooftop bar to sip cocktails, because that is what every responsible parent would do.

The last morning before our return home unfortunately did not get any better. Brought the kids to the pool after breakfast, and they had run out of towels. I had to go to the gym and grab a couple of the small towels to try to dry the kids. There was also mold/algae at the children's pool entrance, which got several kids (including mine) landing on their butts before they entered the pool.

At 10am I also requested for a late check-out because my ferry was only leaving at 2:30pm. I was told I could stay in one of our rooms until 1.30pm, which I thought was reasonable. At 12:30pm however, we received a call to the room asking us why we had not vacated that room (we had already returned the other room at 11am), and what time we were intending to leave. 

At this price point, I know of many other Marriott properties in Bali and other parts of ASEAN which can offer much better value.
title: Disappointments and Frustrations

text:
Comfortable new hotel right beside the ferry terminal. 
Everything is spanking new, and housekeeping was prompt. 

We took the "ocean" facing room with a bathtub and lounge access. View from room = ferry terminal, kampung/mosque opposite and ships anchored outside. Soundproofing is good; we didn't hear the prayers. 
Marriott provides all the basic necessities and toiletries, so you'll just need to bring yourself. My only gripe was that the water was cold in the morning, despite being in hot shower mode. Tv channels are international, so you will get HBO, discovery, Nat Geo. 

Service is excellent. Staff are always smiling, greeting you by your name, accommodating to all requests. We were particularly pleased with the service in M club (lounge) and were very happy to hang out there. Food at M club is average though. 

The swimming pool is small, with dozens of children hanging around especially in the late mornings. There are pool facing rooms, which could be good for families. 
Gym is small, but sufficient. 

Grand batam mall is a short taxi ride away. Eska spa next to Marriott is decent. We had massages and manicures done there. Apart from this and morning bakery, there's absolutely nothing at harbour bay mall. 

If it's your birthday, tell them! They gave us a cake and a nice towel "cake" surprise :D
title: New hotel good for short stay

text: I stayed at the marriott with my daughter and 4yr old granddaughter on the 6th May 2022. Received the best check in service fr Rahmat at front desk. He was so helpful, so accomadating and knew that we were tired since we were delayed frm spore and did everything possible to attend to our needs. Always a smile on his face and service from the heart and so genuine. Rizal the guy that worked at the pool was also the same. They remembered our names and addressed us by our names everytime we met. My granddaughter was so taken by him that she will look frm him every morning since our room had the pool view. Breakfast was great, good selection of food. However the alacarte menu I must say was not so good. Food was average and served cold. Housekeeping was very slow when we asked fr extra shower gel. Took more than an hr. On the whole it was a great stay. Rahmat and rizal  were the stand outs. They were excellent and I never had any experience frm any staff at any hotels I stayed in batam except frm these 2 guys. Oh the spa was good too. Staff there were so friendly and always ready to assist. Location was fabulous and the room was just amazing. This was my first getaway after Covid and I must say I enjoyed it. I will definetely go back and I just want Mariott to know that if u have these 2 amazing staff Rahmat and Rizal, they shd defetinetey be there to stay. Its people like them that make the hotel what it is and being the Mariott, these 2 shd be there fr the long term

title: Amazing Stay with Batam Marriott Harbour Bay

text:
Just completed a family vacation with my wife and parents at the Marriot Harbour Bay. This is a fairly new 5 star hotel under the marriot group in Batam. It is literally  steps away from the harbour bay mall where the horizon ferry departures and arrivals are located. After a short 35min ferry ride from tanah merah terminal once we exited the mall on it was just steps away from mall exit. Location wise is great if you plan to hang around harbour bay where there is plenty of  F&B restaurants to choose from. There is a Chinese hotpot place, korean BBQ, some western dining alfresco and plenty  of seafood restaurants to choose from. For those who fancy seafood like us you can pick from the newer restaurants along the recent developed promenade or the inner part of the bay area where there are still 2 longstanding seafood places. The main difference is the views. The newer promenade dining  faces the sea while the old quarter establishments  look across some residential housing on stilts.  Pricing and taste is subjective so its best to try on your own first. Back to  the hotel appriasal, the staff are friendly and greet you at every opportunity. They were also very helpful eg. my father's shoe  sole came off partially and we seeked help from the reception to get housekeeping to get it  glued back. And when my wife wanted to visit the rooftop bar for some pictures overlooking the straitef  just before we left, we contacted Jesse the marriot bonvoy concierge and the next day she got her wish. Faruq from the reception opened up the rooftop area for us to get a few pictures and helped us take some memorable  family photos as well.( No we did not drink or anything and the bar isnt opened in the morning so fellow  visitors plz don't try your luck). At the morning buffet Goji restaurant, the staff are equally polite and helpful in delivery your food plates or drinks to your table. So definitely top notch in terms of the human touch. But there are a few let downs of the hotel which I find very perplexing 

Cons:
1) the lift sensors are really bad and one has to tap a few times on the card to get the room floor selected. No it's definitely not the specific room card prob. On our last day heading down for breakfast, the lift actually closed onto my mum who was engrossed in getting something from her handbag and bumped her elbow. My wife also had once  during our 3 day stay had to block the empty lift door from closing with her hands before we even stepped in. Mgmt Team should really look into this as may be potential hazard

2) the room has a shower area with  a combined rain shower and a handheld shower. The biggest issue I have is the hot and cold water signs are not there. On the first day you either get scalded by hot water or shocked by cold water. There is some faint engraving on the metal rainshower tap but I'm 100% sure there is nothing displayed on the handheld shower tap controls. Most hotels or showers would have a proper hot and cold label with colour code inscribed but there is none of such sorts here so good luck to those in a rush

3) My wife and mum used the in house spa called Quan( pronounced in a French way) so I was in the hotel when they went for the massage  session. I received an email from Eska Spa indicating about services rendered and the amount. Initially i though my credit card had been swiped or something and I reached out to my wallet to double check. Turns out Eska Spa is the outsourced Spa service( not too sure whether it's permanent or temporary). They were charged 400K individually for the massage  total 800K. Tax was around 380K idr. The total email receipt was for 1.18 mil idr I was shocked initially as I read indonesia tax rate was only 10% for goods and services. To make matters worse, when my wife returned she showed me a receipt for 1.54 mil rupiah. After much clarification with the in app concierge Jesse, I was told there was a 35% entertainment tax levied in additional to the 10% goods and service tax. But to me as visitor from a foreign country I feel that that need to be properly displayed because a lump sum tax of almost 40+ percent  is literally unheard of and visitors might feel its a rip off if there isn't clarification. As for the 1.54 mil receipt apparently the Spa keyed in a longer massage slot of 1.54mil. They did refund my wife cash but they didn't reissue a new receipt. Can you can imagine the confusion when I compared the two e receipt vs what she showed me.

3) This is prob the most basic. The room phone has a few labels but none that points to getting to reception for help/services. It only indicates room to room, local dialling and overseas calls. Quite honestly during my 3 day stay I couldn't even reach out to anyone because one of the buttons " At your service" led to a constant engaged tone. I tried it out at different intervals and timings but all same outcome. So one may ask how I did I get request for extra pillows, bathrobe for the pool( there was only 1 in my room for me and my wife) and shower gels. I had to use marriot bonvoy mobile app chat with us function on mobile phone to reach out to a concierge. Or when we wanted to get reservations done during the day we literally took the lift down to the 2nd floor reception to talk to a staff. So imagine that for your lesser tech savvy guests how much inconvenience it is. I was informed by Jesse on the mobile app chat why didn't I press 0 for reception. So only  after 2 days I knew.........( because there was no indications)

So Dear Marriot Team if you reading this I really rate you highly  for the staff hospitality BUT at the same time I feel let down  by the utility/ functionality aspects of your hotel services. Hence this is a very conflicting stay for me. Hope the management can look into the aspects I mentioned
title: A very conflicted experience

text: The Marriott is hands down the best bayfront city hotel in Batam. You'll pay a bit of a premium, but the service and superb cuisine make this worth the splurge. It's probably worth it to include breakfast as this is one of the best bfast buffets in Batam. Do try some of the other food as well such as our the Buddha Bowl. Many of the staff have worked in Bali or internationally and so are accustomed to a high level of service. The staff really work hard to know your name and serve well. The pool is on the small side but offers a gorgeous view out over the sea toward the hills of Sekupang. Book a sea view room if you want to enjoy the views from the room. This is one of the newest hotels in Batam at the moment and still feels very new. Thankfully the hotel has been able to keep the AC on despite pandemic challenges, so that's a plus. The rooms are tastefully decorated and well-designed. Keep up the good work Marriott team!
title: Superb International 5-Star Service with a View + Great Eats

text:
Batam Marriott Hotel is a new hotel in Batam. The room was comfortable and everything worked well. The swimming pool is nice with a sea view.

Wonderful staycation, will be back again.

text:
Had a quick staycation for a night on our anniversary. A colleague that helped me book the hotel did inform the hotel that it’s our anniversary, so the hotel did a simple decoration inside the room, prepared a cake on the table with a personalized hand-drawn card. Love the service and the excellent details!!

Room was spacious, clean, bathroom was great, bath amenities were from THANN which smells greaaatt, reminds me of our honeymoon trip to a resort in Khao Lak, Thailand. 

Had an anniversary dinner and the food was great! 
Breakfast was superb, they didn’t serve all items on the buffet table because it’s pandemic i guess to keep it clean, but we can order anything on the breakfast menu and the chef would cook it for us.

Special mention for all the staffs for the great service, friendly and helpful throughout the stay! 
Will definitely go back here for a staycation. Soon.

P.S. they make sure everyone is wearing mask around the facilities, and they place hand sanitizer dispenser everywhere around the building. SUPER SAFE!
title: Great stay!
